Articles.Content: The little green guys who (Might) go to space (Or their Graves) are called kerbals, not Kerbins or Kermins.
You can say this as many times as you want, but the noobs will still refuse to call them their proper names.

I seem to recall someone making a chart of common spelling mistakes in the tutorials section, i'll link it if I can find it.

(also, no mention of "minimus"?)

EDIT: Here ya go, credit to [**GregroxMun**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/36101-GregroxMun): [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104282-How-to-refer-to-things-correctly?highlight=kerbin+kerbol](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104282-How-to-refer-to-things-correctly?highlight=kerbin+kerbol)

Nowhere in the game is the star called Kerbol - it's just the sun. And Mun isn't German and, therefore, doesn't have an umlaut.

Let's not get snippy about terminology. After all, the proper name for the little green guys is Kermans. "Kerbal" is the adjective form, but it's become so common that nobody bothers to correct it anymore.
